title: La NASA decide traer de vuelta la nave Starliner a la Tierra sin tripulación
summary: Read this release in English here. La NASA traerá la nave espacial Starliner de Boeing de vuelta a la Tierra sin los astronautas Butch Wilmore y Suni Williams a bordo, según anunció la agencia el sábado. Este retorno sin tripulación permite a la NASA y a Boeing seguir recopilando datos de pruebas sobre Starliner durante su […]

title: Station Science Top News: August 23, 2024
summary: Researchers successfully produced cellulose from bacteria cultured on the International Space Station for four weeks. The bacteria used in the experiment, K. hansenii, is known to produce the highest amount of cellulose and could be considered for large-scale production in microgravity to support the development of materials used in construction, clothing, and the supply of […]

title: Dr. Irene Duhart Long
summary: Dr. Irene Duhart Long was the first female and the first minority to hold the position of chief medical officer at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, as well as the first African American female to serve in the Senior Executive Service at the center. These distinctions were only two of many firsts in her […]

title: Webinar Replay – Space: The Next Frontier of Strategic Competition
summary: In recent years space has transformed from a realm of scientific exploration to a potential battleground and arena for strategic rivalry. Nations are increasingly viewing space capabilities as essential to […]

title: Cassiopeia A, Then the Cosmos: 25 Years of Chandra X-ray Science
summary: By Rick Smith On Aug. 26, 1999, NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory opened its powerful telescopic eye in orbit and captured its awe-inspiring “first light” images of Cassiopeia A, a supernova remnant roughly 11,000 light-years from Earth. That first observation was far more detailed than anything seen by previous X-ray telescopes, even revealing – for the first […]

title: One of the most adventurous human spaceflights since Apollo may launch tonight
summary: Liftoff is set for 3:38 am ET in Florida.

title: SpaceX bails out Boeing and employees are reportedly ‘humiliated’
summary: SpaceX will rescue the NASA astronauts that are stuck aboard the International Space Station (ISS) bringing them back on the Crew-9 vehicle...

title: Live coverage: Polaris Dawn astronauts to launch on historic mission featuring first commercial spacewalk
summary: The crew trained for more than two-and-a-half years to prepare for their spacewalk and an on-orbit Starlink demonstration. Liftoff from Launch Complex 39A is set for 3:38 a.m. EDT (0738 UTC).

title: NASA, Blue Origin Invite Media to New Glenn Launch of Mars Mission
summary: NASA and Blue Origin are preparing for the agency’s ESCAPADE (Escape and Plasma Acceleration and Dynamics Explorers) mission, which begins on the inaugural launch of the company’s New Glenn rocket. The mission will study the solar wind’s interaction with the magnetosphere on Mars. Blue Origin is targeting no earlier than Sunday, Oct. 13, for the […]

title: Mynaric ousts CEO amid production troubles
summary: WASHINGTON — Laser communications technology firm Mynaric announced Aug. 26 the immediate dismissal of its CEO Mustafa Veziroglu and the appointment of a chief restructuring officer, following recent reports of […]
